root: ^Hello again, little one, what can I do for you?

s: ^Can you tell me about your travels?
^You mentioned that Jon's your uncle. I was wondering, what's with the sword? He wouldn't tell me about it for some reason.

Uncle: ^Well aren't you a nosy little thing. Well, it's not really my place to say, and I don't know much about it,
^but I do know that it's older than this tavern. If I'm remembering correctly, I believe he was an adventurer before opening the tavern.
^When I left for my travels, he gave me a bunch of maps from all over the kingdom, as well as a travelling kit to help me start out. It was quite helpful actually.
^Do you want to know anything else, little one?

s: ^Can you tell me about your travels?

Travels: ^I'm afraid that you'll have to be more specific my dear, I've been all over the kingdom. Perhaps you'd wish to hear about the time I spent in the Caves of Ciaphas?
^Or perhaps my escape from the Mashes of Katla,
^or maybe even the ruins in the Kendel Plains?

s: ^Can you tell me about the caves?
^You found Ruins out in the Kendal Plains? I thought they were barren!?

Caves: ^Ah, the Caves of Ciaphas, it is truly one of the most magical places, and the view is just as lovely.
^If you ever get the chance I urge you to go. I actually made my staff from the great Oak that grows in the deepest part of the caves.
^I imagine an instrument made from the same wood would suit you well. It actually enhances the ambient magic levels surrounding it.
^Do you want to hear about my other travels, my dear?

s: ^You found Ruins out in the Kendal Plains? I thought they were barren!?
^No, thank you. I need to start my performance soon.

g-4: ^Well little one, I look forward to seeing you play.

Marshes: ^The Marshes are a deadly place. It was once the site of a great battle, but most of the details have been lost to time, unfortunately.
^But the land is still saturated with the blood and bones of that battle, and a great evil has settled over the it. I went there looking for a lost relic, and I found it but...
^It was not worth the price I paid. Never go there, unless it is at sword point. I... can we talk about something else please?

s: ^Can you tell me about the caves?
^You found Ruins out in the Kendal Plains? I thought they were barren!?
^No, thank you. I need to start my performance soon.

g-2: ^Well little one, I look forward to seeing you play.

TheRuins: ^They are! The ruins are actually in a reality fold found near the centre.

^The ruins themselves aren't too special, just some old houses and ruined foundations. But the magic in the fold itself is extraordinary, and the entrance is barely a meter wide, and only half as tall.

^If I hadn't tripped over a bit of dirt and fell into it, I would have never found it! I spent months studying the fold, and still only have a basic understanding of it. Oh, how I'd love an opportunity to talk to the caster!
^I'm sorry, my dear, did you want to know anything else?

s: ^Can you tell me about the caves?
^No, thank you. I need to start my performance soon.

g-2: ^Well little one, I look forward to seeing you play.
